meanings.definition: A person or company that enters into a contract with a main contractor to perform part of the work on a project.
meanings.sent1: The subcontractor completed the electrical wiring for the new building.
meanings.sent2: The main contractor hired a subcontractor to paint the walls.
meanings.sent3: The subcontractor joked that they were the 'painting Picasso' of the construction world.
meanings.sent4: The subcontractor's role was like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the project.
meanings.sent5: Every project needs a reliable subcontractor to handle specialized tasks.

meanings.definition: To engage (a person or company) as a subcontractor.
meanings.sent1: The construction company decided to subcontractor the plumbing work.
meanings.sent2: They subcontractored the landscaping to a local business.
meanings.sent3: The decision to subcontractor the roofing job saved them time and effort.
meanings.sent4: She subcontractored the task with confidence in their abilities.
meanings.sent5: To successfully complete the project, they needed to subcontractor certain tasks.
